rComments: Lectures were long and incredibly boring. Cooper is not well versed in the production side of film making and often uses the excuse of being a "film scholar, not a film maker" on a number of occasions then asking the class for the answers. She has the absolute worst taste in movies but if you don't watch them you will fail. Essays are easy.

The class is the definition of an introductory class. You learn the basics of the history of film and some basic film/production terminology. Her lectures cover the materials your tested on but if you aren't familiar with film then you will need to read.  Go to lecture, take notes, and if you don't stay for the movies you will fail the class.

I thought her lectures were interesting/insightful. She talks a lot about film ideology: race, gender, class, etc and their intersectionalities, which I thought personally was really refreshing. The essays  easy, readings  LONG, discussions  interesting, sections  ATROCIOUS. overall, she's great + she helped me IMMENSELY throughout the quarter.

Lectures are incredibly unorganized and chaotic. While the material is interesting, Cooper isn't and always seems unprepared. Moreover, she says a lot of problematic things about race and race relations. Attendancepartici is mandatory, which isn't a big thing, except when you have to sit through 2 hours of her dissicussions. Essays are easy.

Cooper is unclear and gives poorly structured lectures. Class content is all over the place and only related to filmTV (in this case) on occasion. There's way too much reading, the rubrics for the papers are unclear, and she can't answer questions. Overall, she's a thoroughly disappointing teacher that doesn't know what she's doing.

This class was pretty easy.  If you're taking it for a GE you picked the right class.  It's easy, there's not that much workreading, and the films are very interesting. One day is a film screening, the other is a lecture.  You write a brief reflection paper (300 words) after each screening.  Just attend lecture and you should get an A.

For every week, we would watch a movie and the next class would be an interesting lecture that would contain certain topics or ideas that the film held. Her lectures aren't boring, because she's very lively and her powerpoints are colorful. Her powerpoints are really helpful towards the midterms and finals.
